db:info.db:title: Qt Quick 3D Physics - Material Example
db:info.db:edition: Qt Quick 3D Physics | Commercial or GPLv3

db:article.db:para: The Material example demonstrates how to control the material properties of a physical body. The scene contains the usual boilerplate of a View3D, DynamicsWorld, PerspectiveCamera and DirectionalLight. In addition to this the scene contains two physical bodies, namely a slightly tilted plane and a box. Every physical body has a physicsMaterial property containing a PhysicsMaterial node. PhysicsMaterial contains these three material properties; staticFriction, dynamicFriction and restitution and these are used to define how the body will act when colliding with and sliding against other bodies. There is a simple user interface that allows to interactively tweak the material of the box so you can see how it interacts depending on its material properties.
